result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin M. Weihert

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:53 PM Defendant Justin M. Weihert appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Janae F. Hochmuth appeared by video for Justin M. Weihert.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Recess at 2:53 PM  Back on the record at 3:01 PM.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE qualifies for PD representation.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends $5,000 cash bond.  Atty Hochmuth requests a signature bond.  $5,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No possession of any firearms and, if released, must surrender all firearms to the Sauk Co. Sheriff's Dept. within 24 hours.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 7, 2022 at 10:45 am.
